name: Hanging Ditch Excavation Reports (UMAU, 1997)
description: Trial trenching and excavation at Hanging Ditch/Cathedral Yard by the University of Manchester Archaeological Unit (1997). Revealed surviving ditch deposits with 12th-13th century material below later cellarage. Contains trench location plans and section drawings.
notes:
Two reports from UMAU:
- Eyre Morgan, 'Hanging Ditch, Cathedral Yard: An Archaeological Evaluation Interim Report' (1997)
- Walker, J., 'Hanging Ditch/Cathedral Gate, Manchester: Archaeological Desk-Based Assessment' (1997)

Available from Archaeology Data Service (ADS) grey literature archive.

Key findings:
- Surviving ditch deposits associated with Hanging Ditch below later cellarage
- Second phase (October 1997) excavated early features within cellarage and trenches across the ditch line
- 12th-13th century pottery, animal bone, leather, metalwork in ditch fills
- Trench plans with location data
